newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka stocks fall on pre-holiday dullness.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka stocks fall on pre-holiday dullness.

text.p: Sri Lanka stocks edged lower on Tuesday as investors kept away from the market ahead of the Christmas holidays, brokers said.
The all share index fell 3.1 points to 594.4 at close of business on a dull and rainy day.
"The holidays and probably the weather kept investors away," said Sanjeeva Gunewardena, manager institutional sales at Commercial Stock Brokers.
Turnover, supported by 100,000 investment bank Vanik shares at 16.50, 108,100 Grain Elevators at 9.25 and 50,000 Seylan Bank at 25.50, was 8.9 million rupees on 436,457 shares.
On Monday, the all share closed one point down at 597.5 on turnover of 8.14 million rupees.
"Yesterday's scenario continued into today," a trader for Bartleet Mallory Stockbrokers said.

"General post-holiday inactivity overseas is having its effects on the Sri Lankan market, too. Many of the foreign fund managers are on holiday and the others are not concentrating too much on new investments," the trader said.
